sites.name: Cathedral of Our Lady
sites.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, this Gothic cathedral is renowned for its architecture and artworks, including paintings by Rubens.
sites.booking_tips: Guided tours are available and recommended for deeper insights.

sites.name: Antwerp Zoo
sites.description: Located in the heart of the city, Antwerp Zoo is home to over 5,000 animals and is one of the oldest zoos in the world.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online to skip the line.

sites.name: MAS (Museum aan de Stroom)
sites.description: An iconic museum that offers a deep dive into Antwerp's history and its connection to the world through trade.
sites.booking_tips: Check for temporary exhibitions that might require separate tickets.

sites.name: Rubens House
sites.description: The former home and studio of the Baroque painter Peter Paul Rubens, showcasing his life and works.
sites.booking_tips: Buy tickets online to avoid long queues.

sites.name: Het Steen Castle
sites.description: A medieval fortress on the banks of the River Scheldt, offering insights into Antwerp's past.
sites.booking_tips: Guided tours provide excellent historical context.

sites.name: Grote Markt
sites.description: The central square of Antwerp, surrounded by beautiful guildhalls and the Town Hall, a UNESCO World Heritage site.
sites.booking_tips: Visit early in the day for photos without the crowds.

sites.name: Plantin-Moretus Museum
sites.description: A UNESCO-listed museum dedicated to the history of printing, housed in a former printing house.
sites.booking_tips: Audio guides enhance the experience, available at the entrance.

sites.name: Antwerp Central Station
sites.description: Renowned for its architectural grandeur, this station is often cited as one of the most beautiful in the world.
sites.booking_tips: Take time to explore all levels for various architectural perspectives.

sites.name: Meir Shopping Street
sites.description: Antwerp's main shopping street, featuring a mix of high-end and high street shops set within stunning architecture.
sites.booking_tips: Weekdays are less crowded for shopping.

sites.name: Museum Mayer van den Bergh
sites.description: Houses a unique collection of art from the Middle Ages to the Renaissance, including works by Pieter Bruegel the Elder.
sites.booking_tips: Check for special exhibitions on their website.

sites.name: Red Star Line Museum
sites.description: Explores the history of the Red Star Line ocean liners and the migration of people to the New World.
sites.booking_tips: Online booking recommended to ensure entry.

sites.name: Antwerp Port
sites.description: One of the largest ports in the world, offering guided tours that showcase its significance in global trade.
sites.booking_tips: Guided tours must be booked in advance.
